text: I recently encountered an error message on my Travis-CI page on one of my public Julia packages : "Builds have been temporarily disabled for public repositories due to a negative credit balance." I was wondering if anybody knows if I can have a free Travis account that works for public (open source) packages. I can't really afford the monthly fee for the subscription Travis account.

elements.text: I recently encountered an error message on my Travis-CI page on one of my public Julia packages : "Builds have been temporarily disabled for public repositories due to a negative credit balance." I was wondering if anybody knows if I can have a free Travis account that works for public (open source) packages. I can't really afford the monthly fee for the subscription Travis account.

text: Time to switch to GitHub Actions

elements.text: Time to switch to GitHub Actions

text:
I hear TravisCI has stopped issuing credits to open source projects.
(First they said they would on request, but as I understand it recent support requests asking for it have had blanket refusal)

text: <@U6NFPDBV1> could you point me to some resources from which I can learn how to set up GitHub Actions with an existing Julia package?

attachments.title: Easy workflow file for setting up GitHub Actions CI for your Julia package
attachments.text: The documentation of the events and badges for the Github actions is not that clear. What do you guys use for the events for the badges for passing tests, building documentations, and coverage?
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Easy workflow file for setting up GitHub Actions CI for your Julia package
